text: Dudhawa is a village in Kanker district of Chhattisgarh state of India. The village is known for Dudhawa Dam built across Mahanadi river constructed between 1953–1964.Hydrology and Water Resources of India by Sharad K. Jain, Pushpendra K. Agarwal, Vijay P. Singh ==See also== * Dudhwa National Park == References == Category:Villages in Dhamtari district Category:Dams on the Mahanadi River
title: Dudhawa
